title: Add Import should ignore leading/trailing whitespace
description: When adding imports with Ctrl+M, trailing whitespace within the selection causes the operation to fail.
OB: When I use Ctrl+M (Add Import), nothing happens due to the presence of trailing whitespace within the selection.
EB: The 'Add Import' feature should ignore any leading or trailing whitespace within the selection and successfully add the required import statement.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a source code file.
2. Select a portion of code that requires an import statement, ensuring there is trailing whitespace within the selection.
3. Use the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+M (Add Import).
4. Observe that the import is not added due to the trailing whitespace.
